sentences.english: He said to his brothers, "Listen to this dream I had."
sentences.chinese: 为了这个梦，约瑟的哥哥们恨透了他。

sentences.english: I really hate this. You know ?
sentences.chinese: 我实在恨透这档子事，懂了吗？

sentences.english: I can remember some expressions which might justly make you hate me.
sentences.chinese: 我记得有些话一定会使你恨透了我。

sentences.english: The recording industry pretty much hates cloud music.
sentences.chinese: 唱片公司肯定恨透了云音乐。

sentences.english: We couples who have been separated hate the ruthless "The Milky Way".
sentences.chinese: 我们这些牛郎织女都恨透了那条无情的“天河”。

sentences.english: A great and terrible hatred rose up in him for the butchers who had refused him credit.
sentences.chinese: 他恨透了不肯赊账给他的肉店老板。

sentences.english: I don't dislike him. I hate his guts.
sentences.chinese: 我何止是不喜欢他，而是恨透了他。

sentences.english: Governments, in particular, absolutely loathe the idea that people can speak without being identified.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是各国政府，肯定恨透了那些匿名说话的人。

sentences.english: She deeply hated Father Madeleine, but made no complaint.
sentences.chinese: 她恨透了马德兰伯伯，但是不出怨言。

sentences.english: He chafed at being turned into a stand-still jump-shooter in Toronto.
sentences.chinese: 在多伦多他恨透了让他成为一个站桩式投手。

sentences.english: The princess hated the woman behind that silent door.
sentences.chinese: 公主恨透了沉寂的门后那个女人。

sentences.english: They hated that beast of a foreman .
sentences.chinese: 他们恨透了那个狼心狗肺的工头。

sentences.english: They hate that beast of a foreman.
sentences.chinese: 他们恨透了那个可恶的工头。

sentences.english: I only hate the bite of the wolf bones.
sentences.chinese: 我是那只恨透了啃骨头的狼。

sentences.english: Dick said that he hated Fred's guts because Fred had been very mean to him.
sentences.chinese: 迪克说他恨透了弗雷德，因为费雷德很卑鄙。

definition: to hate sb to the bone (idiom)
to have had enough of/to be fed up with/to have had one's fill of
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
to kill/to cause death/to do sb to death
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
